terrapeer.vui.j3dui.visualize.change
Class ChangeSensor

java.lang.Object
  terrapeer.vui.j3dui.visualize.change.ChangeSensor
Direct Known Subclasses:
NodeExternalChangeSensor, ViewExternalChangeSensor, ViewInternalChangeSensor
public abstract class ChangeSensor
extends java.lang.Object

Abstract base class for sensors that detect change events.

This class maintains a global list of change sensors as well as a mapping of change sensors by the actuators that can effect changes in them. Whenever a potential change occurs, as detected by cooperating actuator classes, the affected change sensors are notified to test their source objects for any change. If a sensor's source object has actually changed, the sensor's event target is notified accordingly.

For the system to work, all changes to monitored source objects, direct or indirect, must be handled through cooperating actuator classes. Source object changes that occur through other means will not be sensed and reported as change events.

Use of this class and its subclasses streamlines and eliminates the original ChangePoster class, which was a quick kludge developed to address several bugs in Java 3D 1.1.2. Because of continuing deficiencies in the Java 3D API with 1.2, this class and its subclasses also takeover the functionality originally planned for implementation with the WakeupOnCollisionMovement behavior, thereby cutting all ties with the Java 3D behavior system.

Constructor Detail

ChangeSensor

public ChangeSensor()
Creates a ChangeSensor that monitors a source object for change.

Method Detail

traceTransformGroups

public static java.util.ArrayList traceTransformGroups(javax.media.j3d.Node target,
                                                       java.util.ArrayList list)
Traces the ancestory of the target node and adds any ancestral transform groups to the trace list. The scenegraph must be dead or prepared for live access. Typically, the trace list should be cleared before using this method.

Parameters:
target - Target node whose ancestory is to be traced.
list - Reference to a list of Node. Used for the return trace list. Never null.
Returns:
A reference to "list". Can be empty. Never null.

initActuators

public static final void initActuators()
Builds the actuator to sensor mapping for efficiently handling changes. Typically called by AppWorld just before making the world live, presumably after the scenegraph and all sensor-related event chains are completed. Can (and should) also be called by the user after making modifications to the scenegraph or to event chains that can affect any source objects monitored by change sensors. Typically, for this method to work, the scenegraph must be dead or properly configured for probing by the sensors while the scenegraph is live.

initSensors

public static final void initSensors()
Forces all sensors to initialize their state and that of their event targets. Typically called by AppWorld just after making the world live, presumably after the scenegraph and all sensor-related event chains are completed. Can (and should) also be called by the user after making modifications to the scenegraph or to event chains that can affect any source objects monitored by change sensors. Typically, for this method to work, the scenegraph must be live.

processAllChanges

public static final void processAllChanges(java.lang.Object actuator)
Should never be called directly. Invoked by a cooperating actuator whenever it performs a change that may be monitored by a change sensor.

Parameters:
actuator - Actuator that is causing a change. Only those sensors whose change source might be affected by the actuator are notified. Can be null or unrecognized, in which case the null actuator map entry is used.

finalize

public void finalize()
Removes this sensor from the sensor list.

getSource

public abstract java.lang.Object getSource()
Gets the source object being monitored by this sensor.

Returns:
Reference to the source object. Never null.

init

public abstract void init()
Called after the scenegraph and target event chain is set up and the world is live to force initialization of the sensor state and that of its event target.

getActuators

public abstract java.util.ArrayList getActuators(java.util.ArrayList actuators)
Gets a list of actuator objects that could cause the monitored source object to change. Typically, the world is (or should be) killed before this method is called. If the actuators can not be determined then returns null, in which case any change by any null actuator causes this sensor to process the change (which can be expensive in time).

Parameters:
actuators - Reference to a list of Object. Used for efficiency to return the list actuator objects, which are added to any already in the list. typicaally, the list should be cleared before use. Never null.
Returns:
A reference to the "actuators" list. Empty if no objects can be determined. Never null.

processChange

public abstract void processChange()
Called whenever an actuator that can affect the monitored source object detects a change. Causes this sensor to checks its source object for any changes to its monitored state. If a change occurred, corresponding change events are sent to this sensor's event target.
